title: ISic001628. Funerary inscription for Jason the Elder
body:
1Ἰάσων πρεσβύτε-
2ρος μηδὲν ζημι-
3ώσας τὴν ἐντολ-
4ήν ἠγόρασεν ἑαυ-
5τῷ καὶ τοῖ<ς> τέκν-
6οις ἑαυτοῦ τὴ-
7ν κοῦπαν ταύτ-
8ην

1ΙΑΣΩΝΠΡΕΣΒΥΤΕ
2ΡΟΣΜΗΔΕΝΖΗΜΙ
3ΩΣΑΣΤΗΝΕΝΤΟΛ
4ΗΝΗΓΟΡΑΣΕΝΕΑΥ
5ΤΩΚΑΙΤΟΙΤΕΚΝ
6ΟΙΣΕΑΥΤΟΥΤΗ
7ΝΚΟΥΠΑΝΤΑΥΤ
8ΗΝ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from autopsy;
  • 2: The form of the final Μ is curious/heavily compressed, but also obscured by the modern repainting.

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Jason the Elder, in no way infringing the law, bought for himself and his children this burial place.

Italian translation

Serena Agodi

Jason il presbitero, non violando la legge in alcun modo, ha acquistato per sé e per i suoi figli questo luogo di sepoltura.

commentary

Jason is a common Jewish name. Presbyter simply means ‘elder’, but in this context signifies membership of a council of elders. It is not certain that this text is Jewish, but the word entole is a distinctively Jewish term in epitaphs, signifying the Mosaic law. The word koupa is very rare in Greek (two out of three other instances also from Catania), transliterating the Latin cupa, which generally describes a tomb in the shape of a half-barrel (cut lengthways). It is common to record the purchase of the burial space in this way.

bibliography

  • 56.1081 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • 17.0440 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • 1960.0459 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001282
  • 229 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • Libertini 1930 317 no.5 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001871
  • Ferrua 1938 73 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002004
  • Agnello 1953 no.60 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002211
  • Ferrua 1958 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001998
  • Manganaro 1959 348-349 tav.40.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001853
  • Manganaro 1959-1960
  • Solin ANRW 1983 746 n.5
  • Noy 1993 no.149 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000166
  • Manganaro 2004-2005 362 fig.4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10003134
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
